private_information: There is exactly one truck in each city.
Trucks can drive between any two locations inside the same city.
A package can be loaded into a truck only if the package and the truck are in the same location.
Once loaded into a truck the package is no longer at the location and is in the truck.
A package can be unloaded from a truck only if the package is in the truck and then it becomes at the truck location.
truck_planner.goal: Contribute ground-level plans that move packages within cities using trucks so that the global goal can be achieved.

private_information: Each city has exactly one airport that is a specific location in the city.
Airplanes fly between airports which are locations, moving between cities.
A package can be loaded into an airplane only if the package and the airplane are in the same location.
Once loaded into an airplane the package is no longer at the location and is in the airplane.
A package can be unloaded from an airplane only if the package is in the airplane and then it becomes at the airplane location.
airplane_planner.goal: Contribute air-level plans that move packages between cities using airplanes so that the global goal can be achieved.

private_information: Responsible for auditing temporal and causal consistency across plan fragments.
Remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as implicit tokens, fictitious post-hoc penalties, and other non-physical shortcuts.
Ensure load, unload, drive, and fly preconditions and effects are explicit and conserved across fragments.
auditor.goal: Produce an audit report that corrects causal or temporal inconsistencies and normalizes plan fragments for integration.

private_information: This agent integrates the contributions of other agents and must produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver.
Keep actions distinct by agent (truck actions remain labeled with truck_agent or truck prefix, airplane actions remain labeled with airplane prefix).
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent plans and audit corrections and output a complete PDDL domain and problem file that achieves the global goal using FastDownwards.

public_information: There are two cities: city_0 and city_1.
Each city has three named locations: location_<city>_0, location_<city>_1, location_<city>_2.
In each city exactly one location is designated as the airport: location_0_0 is an airport and location_1_0 is an airport.
Trucks operate only within a single city and can drive between any two locations in that city.
Airplanes operate between airports and fly from an airport in one city to an airport in another city.
Action types available: load_into_truck, load_into_airplane, unload_from_truck, unload_from_airplane, drive_truck, fly_airplane.

Restrictions: loading requires package and vehicle in same location, unloading requires package in vehicle, drive requires truck at source and source and destination in same city, fly requires airplane at source airport and destination is an airport.
Initial facts: location_0_0 is an airport.
Initial facts: location_1_0 is an airport.
Initial facts: airplane_0 is at location_1_0.
Initial facts: airplane_1 is at location_0_0.
Initial facts: package_0 is at location_1_2.
Initial facts: package_1 is at location_0_2.
Initial facts: package_2 is at location_0_2.
Initial facts: truck_0 is at location_0_1.
Initial facts: truck_1 is at location_1_1.
Initial facts: location_0_0 is in the city city_0.
Initial facts: location_0_1 is in the city city_0.
Initial facts: location_0_2 is in the city city_0.
Initial facts: location_1_0 is in the city city_1.
Initial facts: location_1_1 is in the city city_1.
Initial facts: location_1_2 is in the city city_1.
Global goal: package_0 is at location_0_0, package_1 is at location_1_1, package_2 is at location_1_2.

plan.system_prompt: You are an expert in ground logistics planning. Analyze the public information and your private information to produce a structured truck-level plan fragment. The fragment must enumerate actions, explicit preconditions and effects, and the temporal order among truck actions. Do not emit PDDL. Produce a machine-readable structured representation suitable for integration.
plan.prompt: Agent truck_planner context: public_information {environment->public_information} private_information {agents->truck_planner->private_information} goal {agents->truck_planner->goal} Provide a stepwise truck-level plan fragment covering load, unload, and drive actions needed to move packages inside each city. Be explicit about locations, trucks, preconditions and effects.

plan.system_prompt: You are an expert in air logistics planning. Analyze the public information and your private information to produce a structured airplane-level plan fragment. The fragment must enumerate actions, explicit preconditions and effects, and the temporal order among airplane actions. Do not emit PDDL. Produce a machine-readable structured representation suitable for integration.
plan.prompt: Agent airplane_planner context: public_information {environment->public_information} private_information {agents->airplane_planner->private_information} goal {agents->airplane_planner->goal} Provide a stepwise airplane-level plan fragment covering load, unload, and fly actions needed to move packages between airports. Be explicit about airport locations, airplanes, preconditions and effects.

audit.system_prompt: You are an expert auditor of temporal and causal consistency in multi-agent planning. You must examine plan fragments and remove bookkeeping shortcuts. Produce explicit causal links, resolve naming mismatches, and propose corrections to preconditions, effects, and ordering to ensure a physically consistent integrated plan. Output a clear machine-readable audit report that lists changes.
audit.prompt: Agent auditor context: public_information {environment->public_information} private_information {agents->auditor->private_information} goal {agents->auditor->goal} Inspect the provided truck_plan and air_plan fragments and produce an audit_report that corrects causal and temporal inconsistencies and removes any shortcuts. Make explicit any additional preconditions or effects required for physical plausibility.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL planning and must produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem file targeted to the FastDownwards solver. Integrate the truck_plan and air_plan fragments and the auditor audit_report. Keep agent actions distinct by naming convention so that ground actions and air actions remain separate. Output a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards and includes typing, predicates, and action definitions that capture loading, unloading, driving and flying semantics.
pddl.prompt: Agent orchestrator context: public_information {environment->public_information} private_information {agents->orchestrator->private_information} goal {agents->orchestrator->goal} You will receive truck_plan, air_plan, and audit_report. Integrate them to produce a complete PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards. Keep actions distinct by agent and ensure all preconditions and effects from the audit are included. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
